Author: designer#4893
Content: https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/31/business/hal-finney-cryptographer-and-bitcoin-pioneer-dies-at-58.html?fbclid=IwAR199yFuR1-mQ1cluo7_rb3DFSCNYRpTM9JMUqn8PqhOizKfpeQAwLnQf-I

Author: designer#4893
Content:
A suspected of Satoshi Nakamoto dies of Lou Gehrig's disease

Hal finney is an early bitcoiner.
On November 9, just a week after Satoshi's white paper, he asked a few questions about the concept of bitcoin, and when Satoshi answered, he became a bitcoinner.

He is from Caltech, and he believes that personal freedom through the Internet is in encryption technology, and he has made achievements in it.
Hal finney got a quick understanding of Bitcoin.

He asked Satoshi Nakamoto about the chain fork problem and so on. realized that Bitcoin's system is the solution he's been looking for all his life.

But he says he wants to see some official or concrete work because the white paper is not enough.
Then Satoshi said, "conversation with him was good, In persuading himself, he said, "I've already considered writing the white paper before I started writing it," and he said, "I want to show you the source code in the near future."

As a response to a genius with respect for a craftsman who's been on the same path his whole life,
It's a touching conversation.

(The question wasn't new, but thank you for asking the most necessary questions at this stage.)

Anyway, saw the New York Times down there,
In 2009, Hal finney discovered the outbreak of Lou Gehrig's
he paid for the treatment by selling the initial Bitcoin.
life of a craftsman who had to leave as soon as he met the solution he'd been looking for all his life.

If Hal finney was really Satoshi, we would have to pay tribute to a genius' humble retreat.

Content:
for intellectuals, the odd currency, bitcoin, is uncomfortable. 
however, "blockchain," the principle of bitcoin's operation, is attractive. 
a neolithic man who first met the iron said, "the iron is sharper than stone, but it is useless because it melts when it touches a hot fire." 
dissolve in fire is not a weakness of iron but a strength. 
because of this, it can be combined with various instruments, making it a much more sophisticated tool than stone. 
blockchain that cut the monetary phenomenon of bitcoin is just rusted iron that does not dissolve in fire.

Author: designer#4893
Content:
evidence of Bitcoin's strength has abounded in the past. 
sadly, people think of it as a group brain rather than thinking on their own. 
the brain of a group that the majority chose ignored or rejected bitcoin, and mainstream media exaggerated only the stereotyped facts that the brain of the group chose. 
In particular, the media has disturbed the 'brain of the group' by mention the words bubble, tulip, drugs, and ransomware.
you can't understand this "serious phenomenon" unless you wake up and study on your own because the brain of the group is in a sleep of idleness.

On July 24, 2017, Bitcoin's chapter 1 ended and a new chapter began.

CFTC has licensed bitcoin-based derivatives such as futures options. people in the so-called banks of banks around the world have begun to look at Bitcoin as part of their asset list.

'Chapter 1' was perhaps an easy game.

It was a time when patience alone could pay off if one understood that Bitcoin was strong. 
but as the wall-street progresses, the previously unconcerned but belatedly realized financial 'first-class players' come to the plate with resourcefulness and abundant funds. 
If you invest recklessly, you may encounter a disaster.

One era has ended by allowing the Bitcoin futures option.
Now 'Does Bitcoin survive?' is no longer a meaningful question. 
It's time to ask seriously whether you, your company and your country can survive the Tokenization Revolution.

Author: designer#4893
Content:
the topic of the new chapter, which will be developed after 2019, is standardization. Bitcoin, crypto-currency, blockchain and distributed-ledger platforms are now ending their birth cycle and entering a growth phase. standardized warfare is hot in the growing industry. 
In the midst of such a fierce war, mainstream media are exaggerated continue by sticking to the old view of 'Will Bitcoin survive?' 
In other words, they treat young adults who grow taller each day as premature babies who cannot come out of incubators.
It's pathetic.
